Class StickFigure

  • Object
    • StickPuppet
      • StickFigure

  • class StickFigure
extends StickPuppet
    Stick figure animation for the Processing programming language!

    • Field Detail

      • size

        float size
        This is the length of each of the StickFigure's segments (they're all the same). In this way, the size variable also represents this overall size of this stick figure. Call setSize() to change it.
        See Also:
        setSize(float)

    • Constructor Detail

      • StickFigure

        StickFigure(float _size)
        Constructs a new stick figure of the specified size
        Parameters:
        _size - Size of the stick figure
        See Also:
        size

      • StickFigure

        StickFigure(float _size,
            PVector _pv,
            float leftKneeHeading,
            float rightKneeHeading,
            float leftFootHeading,
            float rightFootHeading,
            float chestHeading,
            float neckHeading,
            float headHeading,
            float leftElbowHeading,
            float rightElbowHeading,
            float leftHandHeading,
            float rightHandHeading)
        Constructs a new stick figure in the pose specified by the parameters. It is needlessly fiddly to write your own call to this constructor. Instead pose the stick figure exactly where you want it, then a call to print() will generate code for you which uses this constructor.
        Parameters:
        _size - Size of the stick figure
        _pv - Position of the stick figure's pelvis (all other vertices are positioned relative to this vector)
        leftKneeHeading - The direction from the left knee to the pelvis
        rightKneeHeading - The direction from the right knee to the pelvis
        leftFootHeading - The direction from the left foot to the left knee
        rightFootHeading - The direction from the right foot to the right knee
        chestHeading - The direction from the chest to the pelvis
        neckHeading - The direction from the neck to the chest
        headHeading - The direction from the head to the neck
        leftElbowHeading - The direction from the left elbow to the neck
        rightElbowHeading - The direction from the right elbow to the neck
        leftHandHeading - The direction from the left hand to the left elbow
        rightHandHeading - The direction from the right hand to the right elbow
        See Also:
        print()

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Creates the stick figure's vertex tree, connecting up all the joints. Places it in a neutral pose in the middle of the sketch.

      • draw

        public void draw()
        Draw the stick figure. This is what to override or hack if you want to give it a makeover or a new wardrobe.

      • setSize

        public void setSize(float _size)
        Set the length of each of the StickFigure's segments to the same value. Thus setting the overall size of this stick figure.
        Parameters:
        _size - The new size of each stick figure segment

      • copy

        public StickFigure copy()
        Create a copy of the stick figure.
        Returns:
        The copy

      • printlnWithComment

        public void printlnWithComment(String line,
                               String comment)
        Utility method for code generation. Pad and print a line of code followed by a comment.
        Parameters:
        line - The line of code
        comment - The comment

      • printVector

        public void printVector(PVector pv,
                        String lineEnding,
                        String comment)
        Utility method for code generation. Generate a line of code which creates a new PVector.
        Parameters:
        pv - The PVector
        lineEnding - Comma if there are more parameters to come, close bracket semi-colon if this is the last parameter
        comment - The comment

      • printAngle

        public void printAngle(float angle,
                       String lineEnding,
                       String comment)
        Utility method for code generation. Generate an angle parameter.
        Parameters:
        angle - The angle
        lineEnding - Comma if there are more parameters to come, close bracket semi-colon if this is the last parameter
        comment - The comment

      • print

        public void print()
        "Save" the stick figure's current pose by generating code for it, which can then be pasted into your sketch.
